revised_title: The Physical and Chemical Basis of Muscular Contraction: Adenine Nucleotide Location in Resting Amphibian Striated Muscle
tldr: The study investigates the location of adenine nucleotide in resting amphibian striated muscle using autoradiography. It confirms earlier findings of adenine nucleotide concentration in the I-band and provides evidence that a large proportion of the nucleotide lies in the inter-fibrillar spaces rather than in the fibrils themselves. The presence of vesicles in the inter-fibrillar spaces, which are components of the sarcoplasmic reticulum, suggests that the nucleotide is concentrated within these vesicles.
